description: The Enum objects field can be passed a valid_values=None set, which disables the enum checking and defeats the whole purpose of the field. This would allow something unversioned to creep into our RPC API, which would be bad.
title: EnumField can be None and thus unrestricted

comments.content: The Enum objects field can be passed a valid_values=None set, which disables the enum checking and defeats the whole purpose of the field. This would allow something unversioned to creep into our RPC API, which would be bad.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danms

comments.content: I think this is worthy for rc1 b/c if it doesn't get fixed in kilo we have to backport the change to stable which sucks, and we don't want to let new things in which rely on this b/c of the api compat policy we have with objects.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/171265
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=c741f98e048dc45f7f70232790b951b2b9ddf713
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit c741f98e048dc45f7f70232790b951b2b9ddf713
Author: Dan Smith <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Apr 7 09:13:32 2015 -0700

    Fix Enum field, which allows unrestricted values
    
    For some reason, the Enum field allows valid_values to be None, which disables
    all the is-this-a-valid-value checking, thus defeating the entire purpose of
    the type. This patch removes that possibility so that we don't let anything
    creep into the RPC-affecting API that would be unrestricted.
    
    The change that introduced this was I7848f8b934c169a76b1cfd875f7905273f9f914b
    
    Closes-Bug: #1441243
    Change-Id: Ia33994402cca5b4569d72860ab5da675134f5a95
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
